title: Teen shot and killed during fight at party in Haywood County
content:
You need to have the Adobe Flash Player to view this content. Please click here to continue.
HAYWOOD COUNTY, Tenn. — A teenager is dead and several others are hurt after a party in Haywood County early Sunday morning.
Haywood County Sheriff Melvin Bond said a fight broke out at the party in the 3000 block of Rice Road, and someone started shooting.
Elia Hernandez, 17, was hiding when she was shot and killed by a stray bullet, Bond said.
Jell-O shots and beer bottles also litter the property where chaos erupted in Haywood County @3onyourside pic.twitter.com/UQeqKL6Rlv
— Michael Quander WREG (@MikeQReports) June 27, 2016
Jonathan Davis, 22, and Carlos Savage, 19, were also shot at the party. Bond said Davis was trying to break up the fight when he was hurt.
Bond said two friends tried to drive Davis to the hospital, but they got into a car crash on the way there. The three were then transported to Jackson-Madison County General Hospital.
Juan Navarette, 19, was severely beaten and flown to Regional Medical Center in Memphis.
Quin Love, 19, was arrested for the shooting and will likely be charged Monday, Bond said. The sheriff's department is still looking for the people who assaulted Navarette.
